message: My first tip would be to to use Ubuntu LTS, make sure SElinux is enabled, have heavy iptables rules, rip out any packages that aren't vital to your app running and make sure you run some kind of IDS.
What is SELinux?  do you suggest using iptables even if you have a firewall setup?

SELinux is basically the only real vestige linux has for security while maintaining any usability, and its pretty mediocre. If you're using a firewall on Linux, its likely using iptables, and if you're using some packaged software its likely in need of some tightening.
ec2 has a firewall service which I use, was just wondering if you are saying to still use iptables just in case that firewall goes down
yes, you definately want to still use IPtables. The EC2 firewall is not really a firewall last I checked.
Well you create security groups, set up what protocols and what ip ranges have access to what servers etc.
